channel.title: Deep Learning on akenji's lab
channel.description: Recent content in Deep Learning on akenji's lab

item.title: Galaxy Shape Classification by Deep Learning (CNN) (Part 1)
item.author: akenji.1118@gmail.com (Kenji Arai)
item.description:
Introduction

I have been studying Deep Learning for a while and thought I would try it out in my field of interest. I like astronomy and am particularly interested in stellar evolution, the formation of elements, and galaxy formation and evolution. I tried to classify the shape of galaxies, which seemed to be relatively easy to do.

item.title: Galaxy Shape Classification by Deep Learning (CNN)（Part 2）
item.author: akenji.1118@gmail.com (Kenji Arai)
item.description:
Continued from previous article.

Why doesn’t the training/testing error improve after repeated epochs? The results of various attempts to answer this question are summarized below.

item.title: Galaxy Shape Classification by Deep Learning (CNN)（Part 3）
item.author: akenji.1118@gmail.com (Kenji Arai)
item.description:
Continued from previous article.

In the previous, we studied with VGG16, but this time we will use ResNet for the model.
